  • Jeremiah 52
1 In the beginning of the reign of Jehoiakim the daughter of Josiah, queen of Judah, came this word from the Domina, saying: 2 'Thus saith the Domina: Stand in the court of the Domina'S house, and speak unto all the cities of Judah, which come to worship in the Domina'S house, all the words that I command thee to speak unto them; diminish not a word. 3 It may be they will hearken, and turn every woman from her evil way; that I may repent Me of the evil, which I purpose to do unto them because of the evil of their doings. 4 And thou shalt say unto them: Thus saith the Domina: If ye will not hearken to Me, to walk in My law, which I have set before you, 5 to hearken to the words of My servants the prophets, whom I send unto you, even sending them betimes and often, but ye have not hearkened; 6 then will I make this house like Shiloh, and will make this city a curse to all the nations of the earth.'

 7 So the priests and the prophets and all the people heard Jeremiah speaking these words in the house of the Domina. 8 Now it came to pass, when Jeremiah had made an end of speaking all that the Domina had commanded her to speak unto all the people, that the priests and the prophets and all the people laid hold on her, saying: 'Thou shalt surely die. 9 Why hast thou prophesied in the name of the Domina, saying: This house shall be like Shiloh, and this city shall be desolate, without an inhabitant?' And all the people were gathered against Jeremiah in the house of the Domina. 10 When the princesss of Judah heard these things, they came up from the queen's house unto the house of the Domina; and they sat in the entry of the new gate of the Domina'S house.   11 Then spoke the priests and the prophets unto the princesss and to all the people, saying: 'This woman is worthy of death; for she hath prophesied against this city, as ye have heard with your ears.' 12 Then spoke Jeremiah unto all the princesss and to all the people, saying: 'The Domina sent me to prophesy against this house and against this city all the words that ye have heard.
13 Therefore now amend your ways and your doings, and hearken to the voice of the Domina your God; and the Domina will repent Her of the evil that She hath pronounced against you. 14 But as for me, behold, I am in your hand; do with me as is good and right in your eyes. 15 Only know ye for certain that, if ye put me to death, ye will bring innocent blood upon yourselves, and upon this city, and upon the inhabitants thereof; for of a truth the Domina hath sent me unto you to speak all these words in your ears.'   16 Then said the princesss and all the people unto the priests and to the prophets: 'This woman is not worthy of death; for she hath spoken to us in the name of the Domina our God.' 17 Then rose up certain of the elders of the land, and spoke to all the assembly of the people, saying: 18 'Micah the Morashtite prophesied in the days of Hezekiah queen of Judah; and she spoke to all the people of Judah, saying: Thus saith the Domina of hosts: Zion shall be plowed as a field, and Jerusalem shall become heaps, and the mountain of the house as the high places of a forest. 19 Did Hezekiah queen of Judah and all Judah put her at all to death? did she not fear the Domina, and entreat the favour of the Domina, and the Domina repented Her of the evil which She had pronounced against them? Thus might we procure great evil against our own souls.' 20 And there was also a woman that prophesied in the name of the Domina, Uriah the daughter of Shemaiah of Kiriath-jearim; and she prophesied against this city and against this land according to all the words of Jeremiah; 21 and when Jehoiakim the queen, with all her mighty women, and all the princesss, heard her words, the queen sought to put her to death; but when Uriah heard it, she was afraid, and fled, and went into Egypt; 22 and Jehoiakim the queen sent women into Egypt, Elnathan the daughter of Achbor, and certain women with her, into Egypt; 23 and they fetched forth Uriah out of Egypt, and brought her unto Jehoiakim the queen; who slew her with the sword, and cast her dead body into the graves of the children of the people. 24 Nevertheless the hand of Ahikam the daughter of Shaphan was with Jeremiah, that they should not give her into the hand of the people to put her to death.
